00010  * All these are dword only (because we're just dealing with the stack..)
00011  */
00012 struct Opcodes
00013 {
00014     const static opcode pushr = 0x50; //+ reg
00015     const static opcode pushm = 0xFF;
00016     const static opcode pushi = 0x68;
00017     const static opcode popm = 0x8F;
00018     const static opcode popr = 0x58; //+ reg
00019     //mov dwords r (reg->mem) m (mem->reg)
00020     const static opcode movr = 0x89;
00021     const static opcode movm = 0x8B;
00022     const static opcode movi = 0xB8; //+ reg
00023     const static opcode moveax = 0xA1;//Moves mem -> eax 32 dword addr accepted
00024     const static opcode add;
00025     const static opcode sub;
00026     const static opcode call = 0xE8; //omg, the intel docs are confusing on how to the call instruction..
00027     const static opcode fldl = 0xdd;
00028     const static opcode fstpl = 0xdd; //dd or 5d
00029     const static opcode ret = 0xC3;
00030 };
00031 
00032 //dd 1c 24 is just esp (1c is just use address in register)
00033 //dd 5c 24 [off] is esp - off (5c is use addresss in register - offset)
00034 //dd 04 24 is fldl esp
00035 //dd 44 24 [off] is fld esp - off
00036 //dd 05 [dword] is fldl ?immediate? ?address?
00037 struct Registers
00038 {
00039     const static register_code eax = 0x00;
00040     const static register_code ecx = 0x01;
00041     const static register_code edx = 0x02;
00042     const static register_code ebx = 0x03;
00043     const static register_code esp = 0x04;
00044     const static register_code ebp = 0x05;
00045     const static register_code esi = 0x06;
00046     const static register_code edi = 0x07;
00047 };
00048 
00049 #endif
